section.title: Creating Templates: Overview
section.para: &PRODUCT; ships with a default template for the CentOS operating system. There are a variety of ways to add more templates. Administrators and end users can add templates. The typical sequence of events is:

listitem.para: Launch a VM instance that has the operating system you want. Make any other desired configuration changes to the VM.
Convert the volume into a template.

section.para: There are other ways to add templates to &PRODUCT;. For example, you can take a snapshot of the VM's volume and create a template from the snapshot, or import a VHD from another system into &PRODUCT;.
The various techniques for creating templates are described in the next few sections.
